replies.bodyText: the same for other classes
replies.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: I believe the naming convention was com.facebook.presto.plugin.connectorName, I find there's blackhole, geospatial, mysql, oracle, postgresql in this convention. I suggest we keep biguqery's naming as it is for now, and then have a separate PR to do cleanup for a consistent naming across all modules
replies.author: fgwang7w

replies.bodyText: sure
replies.author: zhenxiao

timeline.bodyText: put the comments above tableIds and datasetIds
timeline.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: fixed
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: this comment does not match the implementation
timeline.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: fixed
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: wrap line 73 and 74 into a function, getTable()
timeline.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: not sure what you mean "wrap into a function", it is a getTable method that determines the tableInfo from bigQuery using tableId  or bigQueryTableId if there's one.
replies.author: fgwang7w

replies.bodyText: When tableId is lowercase and tableIds doesn't contain the mapping, it will use the lowercase tableId in bigQuery.getTable. is this OK?
replies.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: yes because getTable may return null, it's up to the caller to decide what to do when there's no matching table
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: public?
timeline.author: zhenxiao

timeline.bodyText: shall we take a review of all access modifiers? we are using default everywhere
timeline.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: yes fixed, most methods should be protected within the module's scope
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: if createWhereClause() returns Optional.empty(), we are not pushing down filters, right?
timeline.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: right, if the filters is empty then there's no pushdown, just added the logic to build the string properly, however the caller in current implementation has no actual filter pass down, we can add the pushdown supoprt in the next phase
replies.author: fgwang7w

replies.bodyText: whereClause is not needed in this function, right?
replies.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: whereClause constructs the filter in a sql statement, and it constructs where clause only when the caller passes in filter
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: the comments does not match implementation
timeline.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: fixed
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: how about inline VIEWS_ENABLED?
timeline.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: fixed
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: inline the string here
timeline.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: done in prior comment
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: do we need this log?
timeline.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: this might provide a better understanding how much data is coming from each split, downgrade to debug if ok with you?
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: do we need these debug messages?
timeline.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: this can be removed
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: throw exception?
timeline.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: no actually it should be allowed that table disappeared during listing operation, transcation should finish instead of failing
replies.author: fgwang7w

replies.bodyText: I do not think we prefer fail silently. Is there bigquery docs, showing it is OK for table disappear during list operation?
replies.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: no I think the purpose was no to interrupt the operation but it'll be the end of the operation so will throw a new BigQueryException here
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: do you think this debug message is useful?
timeline.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: i can remove this log for now
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: could we merge the logic of BigQueryEmptyProjectionPageSource into BigQueryResultPageSource?
timeline.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: BigQueryPageSourceProvider implements ConnectorPageSourceProvider, and BigQueryEmptyProjectionPageSource implements ConnectorPageSource, 2 different purpose, let's leave it for now
replies.author: fgwang7w

replies.bodyText:
seems strange having a separate BigQueryEmptyProjectionPageSource
BigQueryResultPageSource should cover empty projection case
replies.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: the implementation is similiar to the HiveEmptySplitPageSource, I guess it's the naming is confusing, rename it to BigQueryEmptySplitPageSource
replies.author: fgwang7w

replies.bodyText:
we need to merge BigQueryEmptyProjectionPageSource into BigQueryResultPageSource
we do not need a separate empty page source class
BigQueryResultPageSource should cover all the logic
replies.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: same as ablove, I'd like to propose we do this logic change in another commit by a separate PR
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: throw exception? or warn message?
timeline.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: castException can be tolerated,so just return null is fine. warning message usually doesn't get issued from connector right? it's handled either in analyzer/optimizer level. I can add a log message if needed.
replies.author: fgwang7w

replies.bodyText: silently appendNull is not good, when there is cast exception. Let's either throw exception, or at least add warn message
replies.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: Why castException can be tolerated? Could you give an example?
replies.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: on 2nd thought this castException needs to be handled using BigQueryException, fixed
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: do we need this comment?
timeline.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: removed
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: is this debug message necessary?
timeline.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: removed debug logs for now
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: requireNonNull for these fields?
timeline.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: ok
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: Nit: Move this after createSql method
timeline.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: ok
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: In listDataSets we update the presto -> bigQuery tableid mapping. Why we don't update table mapping in the same way here?
timeline.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: ok
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: change all protected to either private all public in this class?
timeline.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: what's wrong with protected? those protected methods may be util functions to be accessed by different callers within the same package
replies.author: fgwang7w

replies.bodyText: protected is used in inheritance. If you want to use it only in same package, why not make method package private?
replies.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: @qqibrow not understand what's your suggestion. private method in the package cannot be accessible by other method across the package.
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: Checking the code in Intellij, this method is used nowhere?
timeline.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: it's registered as a custom validation method so that at initialization time to boostrap bigquery connector, configuration factory callsvalidateRegisteredConfigurationProvider method to validate the credentials
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: This implies all queries have to be under the same project. Is queries from different project id a valid user case?
timeline.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: it's project.dataset.table, so it's valid to have a multiple projectIds
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: Nit: For next step, might consider implement getSessionProperties to provide query specific control. e.g, maybe we want to set different bigquery.parallelism for queries?
timeline.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: sure, that's on the future roadmap
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: I am not sure which one to pick, READ_COMMITTED  or READ_UNCOMMITTED. @zhenxiao can provide more insights.
timeline.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: bigquery uses a snapshot isolation method which reads last committed value, so iso-level READ_COMMITTED is chosen in presto
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: Not related to this PR. I recalled for such credential information, presto will print it out in plain text in log during initialization. Have we fixed that? @zhenxiao   If not we might want to address that. One way could be introducing a new annotation sth like @secret in airlift-config module and mask such configs when print out log.
timeline.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: get it. good idea. let's submit PR in airlift-config
replies.author: zhenxiao

timeline.bodyText: remove credentialsKey  and credentialsFile  as they are not used?
timeline.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: sure
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: Do we need to assert  credentialsCreator.get().isPresent() ? In other words, if credentialsCreator is empty, are queries still able to go through?
timeline.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: invoker of getCredentials will need to validate per needed. credentialsCreator can be empty which simply means no credentials provided.
replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: Not used
timeline.author: qqibrow

+package com.facebook.presto.plugin.bigquery;
+
+import com.facebook.presto.spi.ErrorCode;
+import com.facebook.presto.spi.ErrorCodeSupplier;
+import com.facebook.presto.spi.ErrorType;
+
+import static com.facebook.presto.spi.ErrorType.EXTERNAL;
+
+public enum BigQueryErrorCode
+        implements ErrorCodeSupplier
+{
+    BIGQUERY_VIEW_DESTINATION_TABLE_CREATION_FAILED(0, EXTERNAL),
+    BIGQUERY_DATETIME_PARSING_ERROR(1, EXTERNAL),

timeline.bodyText: Could we either add comment or change method name to show why NO_ROWS_TO_GENERATE  is used here?
timeline.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: this means it's an non-empty projection, read stream returns rows from bigquery storage without intermediary.
replies.author: fgwang7w

replies.bodyText:
I have the same concern with @qqibrow the definition of emptyRowsToGenerate NO_ROWS_TO_GENERATE are misleading. After we merge the EmptySplitPageSource class, our logic could be simpler.
Let's fix this class after merge the EmptySplitPageSource class.
replies.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: @qqibrow @highker @beinan what do you think? I feel keeping EmptySplitPageSource makes the logic complicated, this NO_ROWS_TO_GENERATE is misleading. Do you think we could keep EmptySplitPageSource for now? Or we need to merge it in this commit?
replies.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: I'm also not feeling good about NO_ROWS_TO_GENERATE.  But as @fgwang7w  insisted repeatedly, I guess it might be not an easy work to replace it in this commit.  keeping it or replacing it, I'm good either way, your call.
replies.author: beinan

timeline.bodyText: method is not used. Will this be used in followup PRs?

replies.bodyText: limit pushdown is supported in future roadmap

replies.author: fgwang7w

timeline.bodyText: Why not just create a custom DataTimeFormatter with control on nano seconds? https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/time/format/DateTimeFormatterBuilder.html#appendFraction-java.time.temporal.TemporalField-int-int-boolean-
timeline.author: qqibrow

timeline.bodyText: This implementation actually fetches all result once in List<> and then return Iterator form that List. We'd better implement the logic using https://guava.dev/releases/19.0/api/docs/com/google/common/collect/AbstractIterator.html. to ensure results return in real iterator.
timeline.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: this will be revised in the future PR in which TimestampType.TIMESTAMP with TIMESTAMP_MILLIS will be supported
replies.author: fgwang7w

replies.bodyText: this will adds memory footprint. please add todo in the code
replies.author: zhenxiao

replies.bodyText: can you be more specific? not sure what is the todo here @zhenxiao
replies.author: fgwang7w

replies.bodyText:
todo should be:
// TODO: iterator based implementation, instead of fetching all result at once
replies.author: zhenxiao

timeline.bodyText: Why filters is not used?
timeline.author: qqibrow

replies.bodyText: filter pushdown is not supported. Bigquery Storage API supports column filterin to reduce the read of data though
replies.author: fgwang7w
